recent.comments:
Nous avons adoré notre séjour. Notre hôte a été d’une gentillesse incroyable et le logement est encore meilleur que sur les photos. Il est bien localisé car à peine à une quinzaine de minutes de Parikia mais dans la petite ville d’Aliki, bien au calme. Nous avons passé une semaine magique et Kristos fourni un service impeccable. Le ménage est fait chaque deux trois jours et nos linges changés. La literie est très confortable et les énormes douches bien appréciables. La piscine est juste la cerise sur le gâteau. 

Vaut clairement les 5 étoiles, alors si vous hésitez, n’hésitez plus et réservez!

Fantastic experience from beginning to end. Great location,convenient to exploring the island without being in a crowded area. The rooms were large with great comfortable beds. The 3 bathrooms and showers were excellent and stocked with nice products, robes and slippers. We were very comfortable and relaxed during our entire stay. 
We also help getting  our bags from the airport and were greeted and welcomed by Blueviu representative. The pool and outdoor areas were wonderful and the view will be burned in our minds forever. The owner was very friendly and wanted to be sure we were enjoying it all. We were given some very nice welcoming treats from a local bakery and some local oil, vinegar, very strong spirits and some coffee to get started. 
Our visit In May was early in the season and the cafe was not yet running but there were many options very close by for dining or to shop. We were the only visitors during our stay which was lucky and we enjoyed every second. 
See you again!

In a word, amazing. We had such a great stay here. It's rare we go back to the same place as there are always new places to see but we will definitely be back here. The villa is just as you see it in the listing; sometimes the pictures can be a bit creative or the environment isn't quite how it was sold, but not in this case. Kristos and his family were so welcoming and we had the best time. 

The villa was perfect. The addition of the onsite bar/cafe means that you can choose to stay at the villa for a day by the pool but order a mojito or two on demand! The local fishing village is 15 mins walk and has a great selection of restaurants and bars, and a beach which means you don't have to go far for great food relaxation. The Villa is in a great quiet spot but everything on the island is within a short car drive so perfectly positioned. 

The villa was cleaned, towels changed etc every couple of days which we didn't expect and anything we needed was on hand. Nothing was too much trouble. 

All in we were very sad to leave and it will go down as one of the best holidays we have ever had. 

Huge thanks to Sakis, Kristos and family for making the holiday such a great experience.

Great place that is newly built, spacious, modern and clean.  The owners are very helpful and if you need to order anything, they have a small bar, cafeteria at your disposal. 

Location is great if you want to be in a tranquil part of the island but you need a car.

The compound has a shared pool, so just have this in mind depending on your privacy need.

Olive Garden is the most incredible place to stay in Paros. The accommodation and rooms are spotless and beautifully designed. The view and pool deck is to die for. The food and service is better than anything we have enjoyed on the island. We highly recommend staying here!!

description.summary: Located in a picturesque estate at the Southwestern part of Paros, this newly-built resort stands out for its magnificent view to the infinite blue of Panteronisia and Antiparos. Olive Garden Luxury Resort consists of 4 autonomous suites with a lovely shared pool area. Combining the traditional Cycladic architecture with a modern twist, Olive Garden resort offers tranquility and comfort with heart-warming sunset and sea views.

recent.comments:
We were helped throughout our stay by Konstantinos who was extremely helpful contact throughout our stay. Our ferry from Athens had been delayed 3 hours meaning that we didn't get to the place until 10pm. Konstantinos meet us at the property at that time and kindly showed us around the property to make us feel at home. He was extremely helpful and even helped us organise a food delivery which was very much needed after the long ferry ride. 

Konstantinos was extremely helpful throughout our whole stay and made himself available for contact to help us with anything. As he was also a boat captain we were able to organise a brillant private day boat tour across to Anti-Paros which I would definitely recommend. 

The property itself is stunning and had everything you needed. The multiple lounge beds, BBQ station and all the seperate rooms make it a great place to entertain friends and family over a few relaxed days. My only other recommendation is to definitely hire a car for your stay.

description.summary: Enjoy the breathtaking views of Villa Rosemary, this  newly  constructed five bedroom villa overlooks  the charming fishing village of Aliki. Conveniently located just 2km from the village (800 meters of which is a country road inlands from the main road) and the pristine beaches of Aliki,  4 km from the airport of Paros and 12 km from the port of Paros.
description.space:
This new construction offers the comforts of home and the relaxation you are searching for overlooking the calm waters of the Aegean blue sea. Unwind and relax in the mini pool- jacuzzi  or sunbathe on the large outdoor terrace which provides panoramic views of the blue waters.  Built-in sofas and  sun-beds are provided  through out  the spacious terrace and an additional outdoor table allows you to enjoy your morning coffee or to dine under the pergola and watch  the colourful sunsets or  the stars above.
The entire living space is decorated with soft  muted colors, modern furnishings, air conditioning and WiFi.  The bright  living room area features  modern furniture and is  overlooking  the pool and the magnificent sea below.  The spacious dining area  is fully accessible to the outdoor terrace.  The open kitchen design is fully furnished and equipped with all your needs .
All five  air conditioned and fully furnished bedrooms are elegant and provide great comfort.  Each bedroom has a private terrace with sea and mountain views.  There are three modern bathroom ,two with rain shower and the other with a bathtub.
Villa Rosemary is a great retreat for both families and groups of friends looking for absolute charm and an unforgettable  adventure!
description.house_rules:
House rules and recommendations 

- Please not throw the paper in the toilet(you will find small bins in every bathroom). 
It’s a general rule all over the island 
- if you remember please turn off the switch for the hot water after you have done the shower 
- Please don’t leave ac machines working while you are not in the rooms 
Be careful when it is windy with windows and door and remember to close all the shutters if you are not at home.
- We recommend not to drink tap water: you can cook with it or wash teeth but the taste is a little heavy 
- please be aware that we are not responsible for any lost or damage to your personal belongings. If you have valuable things we suggest to bring them with you 
- please respect the quite hours from 3 till 5 pm and from 23 pm till 8 am

 BIO- Founders of The Detailor

Gabriella with Academic studies at UAL –is a world top 2 university for Art & Design and later she became firmly established as an Interior Architect at YOO by Philippe Starck (Worldwide global leaders in Hotel and Residential design with over 90 projects in 29 countries), not to mention her three years contribution at the Luxury property development company Finchatton (over 60 major development projects worth in excess of billion around the world). Since 2018 runs her own Interior design business (GP Interiors) with over 5 projects already and most notable her private owned villa in Tinos Island, The Detailor - Tinos House Cyclades.
 
On the other hand Thanassis studied Marketing Communication at the American College of Greece (Deree) and then Hospitality Management at ESE London. Throughout the last decade he has worked for the two leading men in London’s restaurant & private members club scene -Jeremy King and Richard Caring, who sit a top two competing dining empires, The Birley Clubs / Caprice holdings and Corbin & King, respectively (On both empires Thanassis’s had a vital role in to the Guest Relations .The flagship establishment’s of both empires, the Wolseley Restaurant and undoubtedly the most prestigious private members club in the World -Annabel’s –Mayfair)


All about Tinos island -

With its strong viticulture and world-class food, Tinos is an engaging place, with a lively and passionate local community spread throughout its 50 picturesque villages.

View properties in Aegean Islands
Play Video
Just a 20- minute ferry ride from Mykonos, the island is worlds away from the hedonistic party scene, and is the perfect location for those looking for a more authentic Greek lifestyle experience.

Tinos has recently started making waves on the international foodie scene, due to its unique landscape producing world-class wines, herbs, honey and cheeses.

It is already an undoubted leader in the realm of Greek wines. T-Oinos Wines is an organic vineyard supplying high-end restaurants across Europe, including Alain Ducasse, whilst the Domaine de Kalathas is an off-grid vineyard making use of 150- year-old un-grafted vines.
In fact, this windswept island is said to be Greece’s new wine frontier, with its sandy soil protecting the local terroir from the phylloxera pest. Meanwhile, beer aficionados with love the multi-award-winning Nissos Microbrewery, open for tours and tastings throughout the summer.

No place has a richer marble-crafting tradition than Tinos, and this glittering white stone is used throughout the island to stunning effect. Discover Pyrgos, an iconic village decorated throughout with intricate marble carvings and almost an outdoor museum in its own right. Be sure to explore the interior of the island, puzzling over the surreal lunar landscape of Volax and its mysterious, monumental boulders. Driving around the island, visitors will spot ornately decorated pigeon houses dotted across the landscape. These dates from the 17th Century, when pigeons were a useful source of both meat and fertiliser!

Sports enthusiasts can take advantage of the annual Tinos Challenge, a part of the Cyclades Trail Cup. Held in December, the event includes three demanding races, including a 20km trail, a mountainous sprint and a ‘mini-challenge’. Tinos is also an ideal location for water sports – Kolybithra Beach on the northeast coast is a particular surfing paradise, with wild waves and  meltemi winds.

The best place to live in Tinos Island  from the Editor's of  Condé Nast Traveler "A thoughtful modern villa with mellow vibes and views for miles" .

The villa is ideally situated in a secluded and tranquil rural estate setting to discover your inner peace and rejuvenate your body.

Embrace the authentic Greek/Cycladic  Lifestyle- with a touch of elegance and find your inner peace by living closer to nature.

A family holiday or groups of couples - experience the famous Greek/Tinian hospitality with your family and create lasting family memories.

A step away from a busy lifestyle-experience true art of living, without modern day distractions. Ideal place to calm your soul and rejuvenate your body from your busy lifestyle.

Ideally suited for nature lovers and those seeking off the beaten track experiences or a place to fall in love with nature and experience the true essence of life. Experience the chatter of birds,the neighbor goats,  the songs of the wind, rustle of leaves, tranquility of nature and call of the wild beauty of a Cycladic Island.

Situated in the south west part of Tinos Island ,15 minutes from the port and 30 minutes away from Mykonos Island.

Experience complete privacy and tranquility in a secluded estate setting and the unique Cycladic style of architecture.
description.notes:
The house is located close to one of the most picturesque villages of Tinos Kardiani and because of its location you can enjoy the breathtaking sunset setting above the capital of Cyclades-Syros island.

Tinos has more than 50 villages, each vying to be fairest of them all. In Pyrgos, famous for its marble craftsmen, sculpted birds and flowers decorate every doorway. In Volax, basket weavers squat outside cottages carved from giant boulders, seemingly flung from the heavens by Zeus in a fit of pique. There's even a village called 'love’, Agapi, where you can tuck into wild-fennel fritters at the only taverna. Tinos takes its food culture seriously: there are artichoke, caper and honey festivals. Marathia launched the island’s farm- (or fishing-boat-) to-table scene, elevating local ingredients into complex modern dishes. For a perfect meal in perfect surroundings, go for cuttlefish risotto and octopus caramelised in grape must at Thalassaki, served on the jetty in Isternia bay, then watch dusk bleed into the horizon from Exomeria bar.

Tinos is only 15 minutes from Mykonos, so it's a wonder it isn't overrun with tourists. The harbour is swarmed on 15 August, however, when Orthodox pilgrims flock here to kiss the icons at Panagia Evangelistria monastery, one of the holiest sites in Greece. Otherwise, the island is miraculously untouched. Solitary chapels and whimsical dovecotes stud thyme-scented hills, dropping to sandy bays whipped by the meltemi wind. There's a nascent surfer scene on Kolibithra bay, where a VW camper van has been converted into a cute beach bar.

Furthermore, If you are into foodie treats, Tinos will set your heart racing. Caper fritters, slow-roast goat with wild artichokes, smoked-eel bruschetta and rabbit with lemon confit are some of the dishes you might share at the island’s pretty, surprisingly sophisticated tavernas. The local wines, grown at high altitude in the mountains, are also exceptional. With dozens of dazzling, whitewashed villages hidden in valleys and tumbling down hillsides, it’s easy to escape the summer crowds and ferocious meltemi winds. Marble birds, flowers and mythical creatures decorate every doorway; this poetic island has a long tradition of sculpture.

Tinos Island has a hiking trails network that exceeds 150 kilometres, you will discover an authentic, unexplored island
of the Cyclades, hospitable and impressive all year round.
description.neighborhood:
The location of the house has the flexibility of being easy and accessible to all favourite parts of Tinos.

Close to the round about that leads you to the mainland villages, to the port or to the north east side as well as the south west marble villages Kardiani, Pyrgos and Isternia.

Our guests will find  arguably one of the most famous and beautiful beaches of the island,  crystal clear sea, ancient ruins ,
.The House is located 8 minutes by car in One of the most unspoiled  beaches of the Aegean - Agios Romanos ( 10 minutes by car) . 


There's also a challenging terrain for hardened hikers but also easier clifftop strolls and beach walks for those who just want to relax in the most unspoiled beaches of the island . Apigania  and Kandani beach  (Hiking - 30 minutes from the house).

We can also arrange- Charter a luxury yacht or speedboat and explore the Cyclades with total privacy (30 minutes away from Mykonos, Syros and the UNESCO Heritage island- Delos).

Impeccable !
Plaka est l'endroit où être. Assez près pour marcher vers les restos et boutiques, assez retiré pour la tranquillité. Stationnement gratuit, ménage quotidien, déjeuner copieux inclus, coucher de soleil tout droit devant le balcon, c'est la place à louer à Milos. Plaka est le plus beau des villages et ce logement est exactement ce dont vous avez besoin. L'hôtel et l'homme du transport sont accueillants, facile d'approche, aidant.
Mille merci pour tout et nous reviendrons sans aucun doute!!
Amazing view from Milos

WOW! Where to even begin. This was truly such a special place, and felt like home the moment we arrived. Not only is the apartment impeccably designed, it is in the most spectacular location. Of all the major towns in Milos, there is so much charm in Plaka, we couldn’t have imagined staying anywhere else. You are within walking distance of amazing little shops and restaurants, we felt like locals by the time we left in the best way! You get breakfast from a cafe up the road as part of your stay which has amazing food. 

All of this amazing BUT the best thing of all is the insane sunsets you can watch from your private balcony. Everyone flocks to Plaka to watch this and having somewhere away from the crowd was so nice. 

Antonis and his team also helped us with car rentals, which you’ll need on this island, and offered to book other excursions as well. Look no further than this wonderful apartment for your Milos trip!

We loved staying here! The view is worth every cent you pay. The house is peaceful, very private, and yet close to the shops. The balcony was our favourite feature; you get the best sunset view from it. We loved having a private parking spot as well. It made such a huge difference to our experience. The bed was reasonably comfy. Host (management company) is very responsive and dealt with requests quickly. Breakfast is included, but it's at a local cafe about 5 mins away, and service is very slow. Food is good, though, and portions are generous. Just keep in mind you'll have to leave the house to get it.

Breathtaking location, incredibly peaceful! I wish we stayed longer! 
Enjoy morning coffee on the balcony and takeaway cocktails at sunset. Bed was soooo comfortable! Host is very quick to respond!Thanks for a lovely stay

All I can say is, wow! 

This place is a dream. It is bright, well decorated, and spacious with an INCREDIBLE view. The private terrace is perfect for watching sunsets and looking out into the sea. It’s so serene and was one of our highlights of being on the island. 
The location is great, within quick walking instances to the restaurants and nightlife in Plaka - however when you were in the unit it felt very secluded. 

The hosts were very helpful with attending to our needs, such as arranging transportation, and were quick to respond. 

I can’t recommend staying here enough!

description.summary:
This is a unique residence located at the cliffside location of the traditional village of Plaka (the capital of Milos). Hanging at the edge of the settlement our guests will be able to enjoy a "caldera-like" view and magnificent sunset but without the crowds.
A spacious renovated one bedroom residence able to accommodate two persons (only two persons, adults only) and offer a memorable stay combining luxury, privacy and panoramic views.
description.space:
This apartment is ideal for people who wish to have a care-free getaway to one of the best greek islands. The modern design along with the simplicity and the natural curves will help you relax and enjoy the privacy, quiet and of course our magnificent panoramic caldera-like sunset.

The apartment has one big open space living room with kitchen, the bedroom with a double bed, the bathroom with a shower, and a private veranda with panoramic sunset view!

No reason to be shoulder-to-shoulder with other visitors to enjoy the sun dipping in the sea. You can enjoy it by having your drink listeing to the music you like with only the person you want to be with. 

Despite the fact that this is an independent apartment, we are offering services and support including:
- Breakfast (included in price) which you can enjoy at Red Bike cafe (Kokkino Podilato), very close to the house! Fresh juices, local products and recipies, coffee of your selection will hlep you to have the best start of the day!

- Full consierge service: My team and I, are avaialble to help you organise to the most your stay in Milos, we can arrange everything from simple car/ATV/scooter rentals to yacht/speed boat charters or even organise for you some memorable experiences (pic nic at secluded beaches, a 4x4 safari, a food tour etc)

Still this magnificent view comes comes with a price. The veranda when it's windy is exposed a lot to the wind which sometimes in the summer can be very strong. So guests are advised to be careful because small objects can be blown away. 

Also due to strict architectural laws which regulate the traditional village of Plaka we are not allowed to have permanent shading constructions and the strong wind can easily blow away umbrellas, therefore the veranda is exposed to the sun after about 12pm and for the rest the day.
description.neighborhood: Plaka is the capital of Milos and of the traditional of the island. Narrow streets, white houses are forming picturesque surroundings.
description.transit:
In our price we include free arrival transfer from port/airport.
The house is located inside the traditional village where no cars can enter. From the point where you can park your car/moto/ATV you will need to walk about 350m

Public transportation on the island is pretty basic so its better to use rentals or driver services which we are able to provide.
description.interaction:
This unique residence is offering to its guests a "full pampering" service!
We will transfer you from the airport or port during your arrival for free, by this way you will not have to worry about finding our place.
We will welcome you and make sure that you will be familiar with the house. If you wish, we will have a discussion about Milos, the history of the house and of course give you all the hints and tips about what to-do-see-taste experience.

We will always be available to you via phone and/or WhatsApp, Viber, to help you with anything you might need.

We really enjoyed our stay in Lefkes at Fróso's apartment. Very clean accommodation, recently renovated and close to a beach in a small bay (no waves for surfers, but good for swimming). Apartment has Wifi if you need it, while phone reception was no problem on the beach.  Food in the local taverna is good, although limited opening hours are from about 1pm to 6.30pm. With that in mind it is worth hiring a car or moped (no buses, although there are local taxis). We definitely recommend a stay.

tres joli petit appartement, fonctionnel, dans superbe petit village au bord de l eau. les hôtes sont d une tres grande gentillesse.
presque dur de repartir.....

Nous avons passé une semaine dans l'appartement de Frosso et nous sommes ravis de notre séjour. Le lieu était très propre, l'hote adorable et l'emplacement parfait. Calme et sérénité pour ce petit coin de paradis excentré de l'agitation du port. Attention cependant a bien réserver votre location de voiture/scooter a l'avance afin de pouvoir etre autonome sur l'ile !

Great place! Very responsive hosts who helped us get more blankets & figure out the wifi instantly! We hired quads from Niko’s motos as well & they were super handy & a great addition to our trip!

Wir hatten einen wundervollen Aufenthalt in Kristens Apartment. Die Lage ist sehr schön und die wir genossen die Sonnenliegen auf der privaten Terrasse sehr.  Die Küche ist netterweise mit der Grundausstattung Öl/Essig/Salz/Pfeffer vorbereitet. Die ganze Anlage ist liebevoll gestaltet und sehr gepflegt.

Die Wohnung ist wunderschön- die Insel noch viel schöner! Unsere Nachbarn haben uns liebevoll umsorgt und uns während unserem Aufenthalt in Milos bei Fragen jederzeit geholfen. Wir können das Appartement und Milos sehr empfehlen!
L'appartamento è molto carino in buona posizione, al centro dell'isola. L'accoglienza è stata ottima!
Perfect location if you rent a quad! About 5 minutes from town and 10 minutes from amazing beaches!

Surrounded by a wonderful garden in a peaceful environment is ideal for relaxing holidays. Fully equipped with all the modern amenities, makes your vacation comfortable and easy.
description.space: The unit comes with a spacious veranda of 50sq.m. which is equipped with two deck chairs, an umbrella and an exterior shower!

description.summary: The “Nesea Sifnos” complex consists of 4 independent, luxury villas with 3-4 bedrooms each, combining the traditional Cycladic architecture with its natural stone construction. This complex offers a shared pool (4x12 meters) that offers magnificent view overlooking Platys Gialos and its bay. The distance from the beach, by car, is 3 minutes. If you like walking, you may also take the path that ends at the beginning of Platys Gialos, which takes 10 minutes to the beach.
description.space:
The “Kymo Villa Nr.2” is a two leveled villa with a veranda on both floors. It can accommodate up to 6 people and it has three bedrooms & two bathrooms. At the first level, you may find the villa's entrance, while a fully equipped kitchen, a dining table & the living room are located in altogether in an open plan space. At the same level you may also find a double bed bedroom, a bathroom & a sea view balcony in case you wish to enjoy your breakfast or your coffee there.

Αt the lower level you may find two bedrooms (one of them has a double bed and the other a double bunk), one bathroom and a private 2x2m. jacuzzi for 4-5 people at the outdoor area. Sunbeds for sunbathing or just to relax are also provided. All bedrooms have shading balcony / verandas and they're bright enough. You can enjoy the sea view from all rooms in this villa. The verandas are a little distant from the pool in order to have more privacy. You can reach the pool from the veranda's exit or through a communal exit. 

Amenities
Kitchen (fully equipped), Kettle, Toaster, Nespresso Coffee Machine, Dishwasher, Washing Machine, Air Conditioning in all rooms & living room, Ceiling Fans in all bedrooms, Wi-Fi, Smart TVs, Hairdryer, Apivita Toiletries (shampoo, shower gel & hand soap), High quality linen, Pool towels, Baby Cot, Private Parking, Window Nets, Closet in every room, Safety Box, First Aid Pharmacy

Services
Included in the price:
- Welcome Basket
- Meet & Greet service
- Concierge services
- Cleaning and linen-towel changing every 2 nights

Check-in: 15:00 / Check-out: 11:00
description.neighborhood:
Platys Gialos is one of the largest beaches of Sifnos, as its name implies. For many years now it has been awarded the Blue Flag by the European Union and is considered by many to be the most cosmopolitan beach on the island.
Platys Gialos stands out for the golden, fine sand all over the beach. Umbrellas, sunbeds, and deck chairs cover only a small percentage of the area and there is also a partial shade offered by the beach trees. There are changing rooms, showers, and toilets and you can easily find restaurants and cafés along the beach, with tables beside the sea. In addition, there are grocery stores (mini-markets), ATMs, pottery workshops, water sports facilities, and the Marina of
Platys Gialos.
description.transit:
Platys Gialos is easily accessible by car, motorbike, bus, boat.
Many hiking trails start from the village, heading towards Fikiada, Vathi, and other central village settlements.

Le logement est indépendant et se situe au premier étage d'une grande maison (Anneza et sa famille habitent au rez-de-chaussée). La maison est belle, spacieuse, propre et très confortable. Elle est aussi bien située, tout est facilement accessible. Anneza est disponible et attentionnée. Parfait !

The accommodation is placed on a very strategic spot on the beautiful island of Tinos and we could easily drive to all villages and beaches! A big thank you to Anneza for the great hospitality and we wish we could have stayed more days!

Nous recommandons cette maison très agréable , confortable, idéalement située.
Excellent accueil d’Anneza.

Aneeza's house was very clean, big and comfortable. She was a very friendly host and was waiting for us at the door with sweets. The house has anything a guest may need from towels, sheets, pots, pans, band aids, soap, toothbrush..etc.
i recommend the house without second thought. peaceful, quiet, breezy and very close to the city.

Logement extrêmement confortable et très bien situé pour visiter toute l’île. Il est à l’écart des villes mais bénéficie d’un calme absolu ainsi que d’une belle vue sur la mer. L’appartement était idéal pour une famille avec des chambres tout confort et bien séparées. On peut se garer sans problème et gratuitement à côté de la maison (il est indispensable d’avoir un véhicule).
Nos hôtes ont été tres attentionnés: le réfrigérateur était rempli de cadeaux culinaires et ils nous ont meme offert une belle tarte maison durant le séjour.

Markos and Anneza were great hosts and there when you need them. They were very polite and wanted to share all they know about the area. We had a great stay! The house is located in an excellent area. It was very cleaned and well equipped with everything you need

description.summary: ANNEZA’S COUNTRY HOUSES is situated on a private property, close to the village of Tzados and a 15-minute drive to the town of Tinos. This location is an important axis point for exploring everything Tinos has to offer; inviting guests to enjoy their holidays surrounded by nature and in a friendly and welcoming family atmosphere.
description.space:
Anneza’s Country Houses is a fully furnished which consists of:
3 bedrooms (1 double bed,4 single beds) – 2 bathrooms (shower in one / bath in the other) -kitchen - living room – balcony and two verandas where views of the family garden can be enjoyed.
description.access: Guests are given the full range of the house, veranda and all common areas, including the garden and the barbecue.
description.neighborhood:
There is a pharmacy, a bakery and a coffee shop close to the property. Also within very close proximity are some of our renowned beaches such as Santa Margarita and Levada, the picturesque villages of Falatados, Steni and Volax and the historical castle of Exombourgo.
The whereabouts of Anneza’s Country Houses facilitates those who love hiking, as there are many well-known trails and pathways that can be explored. You can find out more about these possibilities at tinostrails.gr
description.transit: Transport can be made by car or bus. Frequent KTEL buses run from the bus stop which is 50 meters from the residence and easy parking is accessible in front of our property.
description.interaction:
We are available to answer any questions and give advice and information if required, both 
before your arrival and during your stay, in order to ensure that you have the very best holiday you could wish for.

We had a lovely relaxing couple of weeks at the house 
Close to the beach with beautiful views and sunsets 
Good amenities and outside space

However we enjoyed our stay and the house was comfortable

The accommodation is clean and cool, with lots of space outside to catch the sun, eat or have a glass of something local. Alex was helpful and friendly but also respectful of privacy. The perfect host. We would highly recommend this place as a base to explore Attica, ideally with a hire car. The archaeological site at Sounion is a must-see. Thank you Alex!

description.summary: A small lovely house that is built with the same architectural way as the Greek Cyclades islands. Its location has a full view of the Saronic gulf and its beautiful sunsets. It hosts up to four guests. The main room of this beautiful home contain 3 beds (2 single beds and a double one). There is also a small kitchen and bathroom, 2 outdoor showers, a dining comfortable table plus a free mini-bar.
description.space:
Fresh sheets and towels are provided and the apartment is cleaned by professionals before each visit. Hand sanitizers and antibacterial cleaners are available for guest use.

The thing that you will enjoy most is the beach which is at walkable distance   of 2 minutes and usually not crowded. Prevailing sport activities are fishing, surfing and hiking. Besides the blue sea you will enjoy the green of the trees at the outside space of the house. A non-seaside cosy place with food, beverages, a public playground, basket and a mini-football court is at 10 min. distance on foot from the house.  At 3 min. by car, when entering Palaia Fokaia 1st road to the right, you can find the best local taverna TA PEFKA (Pine Trees-Giannis Papayiannis, 1st one to the right) with excellent ribs, short-fin squids, goat-cheese croquettes, fried courgettes or Eleni's home-made stuffed vine leaves at low price.

* The apartment is also available for events (weddings, baptisms etc.) or parties, but always upon request and with extra fee. That extra fee is based on the communication with the owner.

* Pets are allowed upon request.
description.access: Access to bed-sheets, towels, transportable beach chairs and a parasol umbrella. Hammocks area available in the 1.100 sq.m. garden to 'hang out'. Yoga matt. BBQ facility with charcoals.
description.notes:
Don't miss to visit Cape Sounion where you can feel the energy of the ancient Temple of Poseidon, God of the Sea. The scenic drive along the Athenian riviera is only about 15 minutes by car or by bus. Very close to Cape Sounion is the port of Lavrion enabling daily excursions to the Kea island.

* The apartment is also available for events (weddings, baptisms etc.) or parties, but always upon request and with extra fee. That extra fee is based on the communication with the owner.
description.neighborhood: The thing that you will enjoy most is the beach which is at walkable distance   and usually not crowded. Prevailing sport activities are fishing and surfing. Besides the blue sea you will enjoy the green of the trees at the outside space of the house. A non-seaside cosy place with food, beverages, a public playground, basket and a mini-football court is at 10 min. distance on foot from the house.
description.transit:
The only public transportation mean is the bus and its stop is near the house. The bus will take you towards Palea Fokea/Anavyssos (5 min. distance where many shops, seaside fish tavernas and a taxi plaza are located), Vouliagmeni lake (18 kms) and to Athens centre (45 kms). In the opposite direction will take you to Cape Sounion (15 kms). The El. Venizelos airport is 35 minutes away by car or taxi.

EKAV Ambulance service and emergency aid (tel. 166), Infection aid (tel. 1135), closest public health care centre 20 kms away at the 1st km of Kalyvion-Anavyssou Avenue

hosts.about: Hello, fellow travellers and hosts! I am a 29 year old lawyer and passionate academic. Me and my family, my mother Jo and my father Spyros, started operating the family facility here in Milos island in 2016,  providing 6 brand new luxury suites and studios with unrestricted view to Milos Bay and Adamas village.  Our ambition is to provide accomodation of the highest standards as you experience the treasures of Milos Island. As I am currently at the beginning of my graduate studies -and, thus, away from the island-- I trust that you will enjoy your stay, accomodated by my co-hosts Jo and Spyros.

recent.comments:
Faye’s air Bnb was great! Her mum Jo was so helpful when we arrived and gave us all the local recommendations! 

The pool area so was relaxing, whilst we didn’t have a lot of time to make use of it, it was so nice to wake up to! 

The bathroom was clean and great shower pressure - it’s one of the typical Greek bathrooms with now bathroom door so to say - so something to bear in mind if you’re staying with friends! 

Overall would definitely recommended and if I’m lucky enough to return to Milos I would most definitely stay again :)

Faye’s mum Jo welcomed us to our accommodation and gave us plenty of local recommendations of which we almost did all! This made our trip to Milos super special and we had the best time. The room itself was lovely, comfortable and spotless, cleaned every day which was a really nice touch. The view is just incredible, one night we decided to stay in to watch the sunset from the pool rather than go out it was just that good! 10/10 would recommend!

We had a great stay here! Jo was there to greet us and gave us such a thorough excellent breakdown of things to do and not to do around the island. We really appreciated all her help! The location is great, away from the noise of the Adamas port. Definitely plan on renting a car/scooter if you’re staying here. Overall we had a great time and highly recommend to anyone going to Milos!
We definitely want to come back again. It was the perfect spot.

Amazing location with stunning views. The pool was fabulous and one of the best we have encountered at an Airbnb.
Didn’t meet Faye but Jo covered all the instructions in her absence so we knew everything. She was very thorough and knows the island well.

It was a great place to stay in Milos, I recommend renting a car though, not walking distance to stores, restaurants or beaches. Also we lost our first day (due to airline delay in Athens, stuck there, no other flights)…came by Seajet the next day but lost a day in Milos🫤

Beautiful location on Milos with great views!  Faye was very helpful and informative before our stay.  She provided clear instructions, directions, and great suggestions for our stay.  Her mother Jo made our stay as comfortable as possible and provided us with outstanding suggestions on places to eat and activities to do.  The property was clean, pool was pristine, and view of the sunset was gorgeous!  10/10 would stay again for a trip back to Milos!

description.summary: Blu Suites and studios are conveniently situated on a hill side, overlooking Milos bay, 5 minute drive from it. Six completely new accommodations, with queen beds, showers and adjoining W.C.s, built in the traditional island style. Air-conditioned, equipped with kitchenettes,  hair dryers and espresso coffee makers .They are ideal for couples. Individual verandas, wonderful view, big 130 sq. meters pool, peace and quiet, away from public roads, easy access by car to the island's lovely beaches.
description.space: Blu 1 is a 30 sq.m new studio which includes a traditionally built queen bed plus an identical single bed aside that can conveniently accommodate 3 adults. Spacious showers and adjoining W.C.s, built in the traditional island style are included. It is air-conditioned, equipped with kitchenette suitable for light meals, refrigerator, flat screen tv, safe box, super soft luxury linen, hair dryers and espresso and French coffee makers. Hi-speed wi-fi free of charge is also available. Individual veranda two steps from the pool with hydromassage with relaxing summer furniture and a wonderful view of Milos Bay. Blu studios' visitors enjoy peace and quietness, away from public roads. An ample and super convenient parking space exists next to the room. The facility in total has easy access to most of the island's majestic beaches by car.
description.access: Each studio has its private entrance and individual private veranda with a magnificent view where the residents can have their breakfast or romantic sunset dinner in front of the pool.If they wish they don’t have to come into contact with anyone else on the premises besides their hostess.
description.notes:
Though breakfast is not provided on a hotel-style basis, guests can use the existed kitchenette to produce breakfast and light meals.
All guests upon arrival at the studio will find on a complimentary basis fresh juice, milk, espresso capsules, filter coffee, tea, sugar, bread, butter and homemade jam and honey and on request fresh eggs.  
Early booking of boat or airline tickets is  strongly advised because of the high demand during summer months!
Pick up upon arrival from port or airport is temporarily suspended due to measures to restrict COVID-19 contamination.
description.neighborhood: The studios are situated on a quiet hillside overlooking the port and the village of Adamas , which is just a five-minute drive or a twenty minutes walk, for those who prefer hiking.Most of the island’s popular beaches are 10 to 20 minutes away by car or motorcycle, but one the most popular spots,Papikinou beach, is a 15 min walk down the road.
description.transit:
Ample and super convenient parking is available next to the rooms. 
It is highly recommended that visitors have a car, motorcycle, scooter or ATV. A 5 minute walk though, gives access to the main island bus network. Hikers can access the port of Adamas in 20 minutes through the main road or alternatively through country paths.
   Milos island has been created by underwater volcanic activity, that is why the coast all around the island 
is lined with azure bays, bizarre rock formations and sea caves. Swim at Sarakiniko, a long narrow sea inlet, sided by a moonscape of smooth white pumice rocks, or head to Kleftiko – cluster of rock formations and caves, rising from the sea, where pirates used to hide – to snorkel or explore by sea kayak. 
Milos’ longest and busiest beach is Paliohori, complete with tavernas and sun beds - its actually three adjoining beaches, composed of red, pink, yellow and white pebbles, and backed by red cliffs, with warm underwater springs. To see the entire coast, take a round-the- island boat tour, departing from Adamas.
description.interaction:
Any possible help and advice that will improve your stay will be kindly offered.
According to our experience, as local residents of Milos and opinions from tourists that have visited our island all these years, a car rental is a "must" for any visitor in Milos. 
Although the public bus network is fairly good, it still does not cover all the possible places of interest , not to mention it is not a 24/7 service. 
Furthermore , pricing is much cheaper when you rent a vehicle especially when you are two or three people and visit 2-3 places per day. 
So, moneywise and comfort wise, it is the best option for your vacation. 
 Car, motorcycle, ATV, bicycle  are available through: https://www.milosrentcar.gr
NOTE: Not EU license holders need to have international driver's license in order to be eligible to rent and drive a car in European countries.

recent.comments: Lila was the perfect host! She made sure we had all that we needed to enjoy our stay, which included a bottle of Prosecco to enjoy by the pool. She was enthusiastic and full of useful tips (restaurants, excursions etc). The house is very well appointed, clean and has an amazing view of the bay. The beaches and main town are a short drive away. We will definitely stay there again.

items.comments: Lila was the perfect host! She made sure we had all that we needed to enjoy our stay, which included a bottle of Prosecco to enjoy by the pool. She was enthusiastic and full of useful tips (restaurants, excursions etc). The house is very well appointed, clean and has an amazing view of the bay. The beaches and main town are a short drive away. We will definitely stay there again.

We had a wonderful stay at Villa Apollon. Lila, the host, is lovely and was very generous with her time and recommendations. The villa is wonderfully situated on top of a hill with terrific views of the island and see beyond the pool and veranda, and a full kitchen and living room gives you everything you need. You definitely need to hire a car, and the villa is a little tricky to find, but it's well worth it and Lila is more than happy to make sure you get there safe and sound. We would stay here happily again.

Lila was the nicest host we had on our trip! She helped in every way possible!! The place was safe and clean - which was the most important thing for us…. Would highly recommend staying here to anyone
Great place

Lila clearly constructed this home with quality and design in mind. Every detail - from the windows to the door hinges to the tiling- is top notch and appealing to the eye. The view of the water and the pool and outdoor space is gorgeous and relaxing, far enough from any neighbors or road to provide complete quiet. The adjacent house is situated in a way that offers adequate privacy. The kitchen came well stocked and includes every possible amenity, as are the 2 bathrooms. The 2 bedrooms have ample closet and drawer space and personal entrances to the patio with views. The on-site parking is critical and the house seems to be no more than 10-20 minutes away from anywhere you’d want to go. Lila is warm, delightful, responsive and helpful. You can truly relax at this house and be well situated to enjoy this magical island.

Lila is a thoughtful, and gracious hostess!! She thought of everything. I was doing yoga on a towel the first morning and later that day a yoga mat appeared as well as recommendations for a local yoga class. She has the best recommendations for everything on the island!

Lila was exceptional! From assistance with transportation details (a car was definitely needed for access to the island of Milos in general), daily local suggestions (all of which were amazing!), friendliness, and responsiveness; she was by far one of our best hosts!
The setting of her home is amazing and peaceful and was perfect for our traveling party of 2 couples.  Having laundry onsite was great for midway through our trip and having the full kitchen with all the extras was amazing! The pool was very refreshing after days at the beach and the hot weather, and the patio offered an amazing view of the sunset and the bay.
We would definitely come back and highly recommend!

description.summary: Two traditional villas, Villa Apollon and Villa Aphrodite, are parts of the Serenity House. They share a private land of six acres full of small olive trees, citrus and fruitful trees.  New built, on a hill named Korfos, follow cycladian architecture, with comfortable interiors and terrific outdoor spaces with a pool. The Serenity House ensures tranquility, contact with nature,spectacular sea view and enchanting sunset. Each villa is ideal for a family or two couples.
description.space: Villa Apollon  is 83sq and accomodates 4 persons. There are two bedrooms with king size beds, fully airconditioned, two bathrooms with showers and a washing machine. The kitchen area is fully equipped with stove and refrigerator in an open plan including the living area. Villa Apollon  has  magnificent sea view.The surrounding area is sparsely populated, so your accomodation in Villa Apollon ensures you the relaxation you desire.
description.access: Villa Apollon has great location. Only 10' min away by car from the port of Adamas and the airport is less than 5' min. In Adamas you can find supermarkets, bakery, grocery, pharmacy, pastry shop and restaurants. Two of the most beautiful beaches of the island, Agia Kyriaki and Paleochori, are the closest(10'-15' min drive). The villages Klima, Plaka, Trypiti are in a distance of 15' min by car and the picturesque fishing village Pollonia is 25'min drive. There is a health center in Plaka.
description.neighborhood: The surrounding area is sparsely populated, so your stay in villa Apollon  promises absolute peace and tranquility.
description.transit: Villa Apollon is accessible by car, moto or atv. There is free parking area.
description.interaction: At your arrival your villa Apollon will be clean. Sheets and towels are available.  Beach or pool towels also. If you wish house cleaning during your stay, please let as know in advance in order to arrange this for you(there will be an extra charge of 75€). We can also arrange your transfers, boat trips and make your dinner reservations(when booking is available).

description.summary: Εξοχική κατοικία που όπως θα έλεγε κάποιος, είναι ένα μπαλκόνι στο Αιγαίο. Βρίσκεται 430 μέτρα πάνω από την θάλασσα και 4 χιλιόμετρα μακριά από την παραλία του Ορκού και την Ιουλίδα. Το τοπίο με τις βελανιδιές προσφέρει γαλήνη στους επισκέπτες και ολοκληρώνεται με μια υπέροχη ανατολή και τον ήλιο να βγαίνει μέσα από την θάλασσα, φωτίζοντας τα κυκλαδονήσια που διακρίνονται. Ελάτε να γευτείτε  παραδοσιακά προϊόντα από τους ιδιοκτήτες και να ζήσετε μία μοναδική φιλοξενία από απλούς ανθρώπους.
description.space: Οι κατοικία βρίσκεται 4 χιλιόμετρα από τις κοντινότερες παραλίες, τις παραλίες Όρκος και Ψαθί. Έχει απόσταση 2 χιλιόμετρα περίπου από το πιο κοντινό παντοπωλείο, εστιατόριο, αλλά και κομμωτήριο. Ενώ η απόσταση από την Ιουλίδα την πρωτεύουσα του νησιού είναι στα 4 χιλιόμετρα.
description.transit: Για τις μετακινήσεις σας, είναι απαραίτητη η χρήση κάποιου μεταφορικού μέσου.
description.interaction: Είμαστε διαθέσιμοι για οποιαδήποτε ερώτηση των πελατών, μέσω sms, email κ.λπ.

Lovely beaches near by, and the restaurants in Aliki are great, not one bad meal. Thanks for a great family holiday.

Lovely beaches near by, and the restaurants in Aliki are great, not one bad meal. Thanks for a great family holiday.

Nous avons passé un excellent séjour chez Mathilde la villa est un havre de paix joliment décoré, bien située ds un environnement  très paisible

La piscine est à couper le souffle ou l'on peut profiter du coucher de soleil...
Mathilde et son Co-hôte Anne sont très réactives et vous trouvent la meilleure solution sur vos interrogations.

N'hésitez surtout pas si vous avez envie de lâcher prise c'est l'endroit idéal

We came here for a family holiday with my parents, siblings, and our two year old son. It was perfect - spotless villa, well designed & decorated. Sunsets on the terrace are spectacular. Lots of thoughtful things like a very good Bluetooth speaker, welcome wine, plenty of toys & games for our son, a high chair, a travel cot. Mathilde & Anne were very responsive and helpful. We love Greek islands and Paros is a good one - a nice balance of plenty of things to explore, gorgeous beaches, but thankfully spared the hordes of tourists of Mykonos / Santorini. Aliki (nearest town) is a pleasant little harbour town with boating & a little beach & lots of restaurants (Thalassamou is particularly good).

Highly recommend this AirBnB!

Soggiorno perfetto, l’abitazione ha tutti i comfort che una casa vacanze deve avere. Ottimamente posizionata per il suo panorama, è molto vicina, 1 ,2 km , alla bellissima spiaggia  attrezzata di Faragas, secondo noi una delle piu’ belle dell’isola .
Durante il ns. soggiorno eravamo in  sette persone, in famiglia, tutte alloggiate perfettamente.
Ottima precisione e assistenza di Mathilde e Annie !

We had a wonderful stay at Anne and Mathilde's place.
The villa is very charming, comfortable and has all the amenities you could think of. The place ia so much more beautiful than on the the photos!
Anne and Mathilde have been amazing host answering all our questions promptly and making sure that they would help us with every little detail. 
We can't wait to be back in Paros and at the Villa Almathea!

A wonderful place. Clean, new, well laid out. What they don’t say in the photos and description is the view. You look out over Aliki Harbor. Great setting and fiery sunsets. We were with 5 minutes of a store (cross market), where you also throw out trash and recycling. 10 minutes from Aliki and great dining and sailing. 20 minutes from anywhere on the island. Like being on your own estate.
Splendid place, Anne is a fantastic host. We will be back

description.space:
Perfect for whoever appreciates surroundings combining great comfort, natural beauty and style,  the Villa offers accommodation for up to 7 people.   

The Villa for rent is one of two neighboring units of this property. The two units are separated by large terraces and walkways. The layout was thought to insure independence and privacy. The  Villa for rent comprises a vast distinct pool area facing the Aegean. 

Front side of the house offers wide expanses of sea and sky, the back side terraces open on a hilly environment including olive groves, vineyards, old stone walls, local plants and trees.

The Villa has a cycladic geometrical design with a dominant white styling  supported by quality materials. Striking the right balance between minimalism and warmth, The Villa suggests aspects of the Greek culture through cheerful light  frescos. 

Upon entering, guests will find a spacious open-plan living room with kitchen and dining area . A corridor gives access to 2 double bedrooms with sea view, and one single bedroom has a mountain view (all ensuite). The south terrace is  shaded by a canopy of “sails” and opens onto a vineyard. A nice place for lunch or dinner. On 1st floor, a separate double bedroom with ensuite bathroom can be found with its own terrace providing privacy and an exclusive sea view.

The well-maintained Mediterranean garden with herbal plants, olives trees and vineyards gives the villa a serene atmosphere. 

Equipment and furnishing has been assembled with care: (Bedding from COCOMAT, Kartell, Foscarini, BO Concept trademarks )

The swimming pool is adequate for lap swimming (18 m x 4 m, twice the common size of pools in Paros) but also has a knee deep children’s area. The pool and its large terrace is somewhat lower and to the side, making it a space unto itself. It is private and for use by the guests only. Near the pool, guests will find an outdoor kitchen with a plancha and a large table to enjoy dining.

The Villa is equipped with a sunshade parking area and fast wifi. Many children amenities are available.
description.access: Go through the entrance gate and take the alley that leads to the back of the Villa
description.neighborhood:
Sandy and quiet beaches such as Faragas and Piso Aliki are only 1,5 km & a few minutes away by car. They are much less crowded than those close to Naoussa and Parikia! Nearby Aliki is an authentic fishing village with engaging fish tavernas and restaurants by the sea, and with all the essentials – traditional bakery, fish market, supermarket, kiosks, pharmacy and ATM.

Directly from the house you will find wonderful walks around the surrounding small mountains / hills and, with a splendid view of the sea and the islands
description.transit: On the hilly environment including olive groves, vineyards, old stone walls, local plants and trees, guests will find many possibilities for hikes and walks.

recent.comments: This apartment was in the perfect location! It was walking distance from the port and some beautiful restaurants and cafe/bars. Our wonderful host recommended the bus to get up to Noussa (and all over the island) which couldn’t have been more easy. The apartment was really lovely and my friends and I can’t wait to come back :)

Logementspacieux et très bien équipé. 
Propreté irréprochable
Très bon accueil de Sotiria qui s'est rendue disponible à l'arrivée et très réactive pour répondre à toutes nos questions.
Très bonne situation dans Parikia avec un petit supermarché à proximité. 
Nous avons juste été surpris de voir qu'il s'agissait en fait d'un appartement (1er étage d'une maison). Cela ne nous a pas gêné car l'environnement est très calme. Mais il n'y a pas d'accès direct au jardinet et un escalier pour accéder au logement.

Une belle maison, et un emplacement parfait pour visiter Parikia à pieds ! Le logement était propre et spacieux, et on ne manquait vraiment de rien. Sotiria nous a accueilli avec une  bouteille de vin, mais aussi du café et des capsules pour la machine à laver : un vrai plus !  
a noter tout de même : la rue est étroite donc si vous êtes en voiture, garez vous directement dans le parking gratuit qui est à 10m ! 

Merci pour tout, et je recommande sans hésiter cette maison !

Très jolie maison de vacances dans une rue au calme et en même temps proche du centre ville et du port de Parikià.  Σωτηρια est une personne très sympathique qui répond très rapidement à vos questions.
Nous recommandons ce logement.
What a great place and Sotiria was an awesome host. She was accommodating and kind. If we came back to Paros, we’d definitely consider staying at her home again!
Loved staying here! It was close to everything in town. Sotiria was a great host, made us feel at home, and gave us some great suggestions for dinner as well.

Σωτηρια met us at the apartment for check in. She recommended a few places to eat and activities. She was always very quick to answer all messages.
The place is exceptional! It's clean, bright and airy. It is walking distance to the water, restaurants, shops, cafés, markets, etc. We cooked one night and enjoyed our dinner on the balcony. The kitchen is well equipped with everything we needed. It felt like home. You can't beat this location! If you rent a car, there is even a free parking lot just steps away. 
Thank you for hosting us, Σωτηρια! We hope to be back soon!

description.summary:
The S&G House is located in the center of the traditional Οld Τown of Paroikia just 5min (400m) walking distance from the sandy beach Kalliera. The house features one living room, fully equipped kitchen, 2bedrooms, 2bathrooms and a cozy sun protected balcony.

Additionally, we offer free of charge transfer from the airport or port.
description.space: All the rooms have A/C. The living room accombined with a comfortable sofa and dining table, satellite TV and free WI-FI in all the area of the house(indoor/outdoor). Warm water is provided all day.
description.neighborhood:
Free parking area, super market, grocery, pharmacy, cafe and restaurants are in 3~5min walking distance away from the house.
The old town that you could find nice stores for shopping, cafe and restaurants and see the traditional old parian houses is 3min away.
A significant information is that the house is located 750m from the port of Paroikia.
Also you could enjoy the wonderful sunset on the seaside road that is just some meters away.
description.transit:
By feet, bus, rental car, taxi, motor bike you could easily reach the house in few minutes from the Port and 15min from the airport.
There are two free parking areas close to the house(3~5').
description.interaction: To welcome our guests we offer them water, local wine and some fruits. We are always available to give informations and suggestions about how you could explore the island in the best way and for any other help according your needs. Sotiria will meet the guests in the house to give the keys and feel free to contact her for anything you need as well.

hosts.about: Ευγενικός, φιλικός, εξυπηρετικός, με διάθεση για φιλοξενία, άμεσα διαθέσιμος.

recent.comments:
The house of Thanassis offers a terrific view of Evia and the bay in front of it. The kitchen is equipped with everything imaginable. There is also a wood oven in the outdoor area, which is also great for food. The house is located in a very remote corner of Central Greece, in a residential area where only one in five properties is built - left and right from the house is green only. You drive for a while to tourist destinations, but a supermarket and small tavernas are in 10 minutes driving distance (by car). Just below the street where the house is located is the sea with a beautiful rocky coastline.

 

You should definitely have a car, but otherwise the house by Thanassis is definitely to be recommended. Thanassis and his adorable family is super hospitable! Many thanks for everything.

Stairs, but the view, it worths it. Wonderful! Perfect house, clean and tidy, with grill and a terasse, with just the perfect view. Perfect for family and friend vacations also.

First of all: the house is truly fantastic. It was built in the 80s but its a claddic beauty. You can sit on the couch while seeing the sea in the one direction and the fireplace in the other. The house is around 100 steps above the sea positioned in the first row. So the view over the sea and Evia is spectacular.

There is enough space and privacy for 4 parties and at least 9 people. Also there is enough equipment and everything is well decorated.

The next beaches have been only a few meters by walking in front of the property. You can reach the village of Theologos by car in a bit more than 5 mins. Its a bit far for walking though. There you'll have tavernas, bars, supermarkets and everything else you need during vacations. 

Despite the bad we had, the stay in Thanassis place was one of the bests in a series of nice stays in Greece. We thank him a lot for providing us this opportunity! Steffi and Martin

The perfect pleace to relax. The house is comfortable and clean. Peace, quiet pleace and the amazing view on the sea and the Eubea island. Nearby there are some nice rocky/sandy small beaches.
Hosts are very friendly and helpful. 
Thank You Thanassis and Marianne!

Great location, really friendly host,  perfect place!
105 stairs but wonderful view!
Everything was excellent, we recommend it.

Perfect house, perfect host!!! We gave quite a hard time to an owner with long stay date changing, but Thanassis took it all as it was and helped us a lot. Highly recomend for families with kids looking for quiet vocation with almost no  neighbors.

The place was a calmness oasis! We enjoyed the tranquil and lush environment just few meters away and with unobstructed views to the sea... all the equipment needed were in house. We refueled our batteries and visited many local restaurants with great food next to the sea... all communication and contact with the owners and his staff was perfect... we definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants a healthy and quiet vacation in a private villa...

description.summary: It is a hospitable and very comfortable house between the pines, with amazing sea view, where you can enjoy the beauty and serenity of nature. The perfect place to relax. Its most unique feature is the heaps of sunshine and fresh air. With direct access to the sea, you can either walk to the beach or take a 5-min drive.
description.space: Προκειται για εναν φιλόξενο και πόλυ άνετο χώρο ανάμεσα στα πεύκα, με υπέροχη θέα στη θάλασσα, όπου θα μπορούσατε να απολάυσετε την ηρεμια και την όμορφια της φύσης. Ιδανικό μέρος για ξεκούραση. Κυρίαρχο χαρακτηριστικό του σπιτιού είναι το άπλετο φως του ήλιου και το δροσερό ευβοϊκό αεράκι. Η πρόσβαση στη θάλλασα είναι άμεση, είτε με τα πόδια κάτω απο το σπίτι, είτε με το αυτοκίνητο σε απόσταση μόλις 5 λεπτών.
description.access: Όλοι οι χώροι του σπιτιού είναι διαθέσιμοι να φιλοξενήσουν και να εξυπηρετήσουν τους επισκέπτες μας.
description.neighborhood: Στην περιοχη μας μπορεί κανείς να συνδιάσει τις ηρεμες οικογενιακές διακόπες, με τις όμορφες βόλτες για πολυ ωραίο φαγητό, γλυκό και ποτό.
description.transit: Η πέριοχη μας βρίσκεται περίπου 90 λεπτα απο την αθήνα μέσω εθνικής οδού. Απαραίτητο είναι το αυτοκίνητο για την μετακίνηση από και προς την περιοχή. Το καλοσχεδιασμένο πολεοδομικό συστήμα και οι άνετοι, ασφαλείς δρόμοι είναι χαρακτηριστικά του οικισμού και σας παρέχουν αξιοπιστή δυνατότητα οδήγησης.
description.interaction: Είμαστε διαθέσιμοι να εξυπηρετήσουμε τους επισκέπτες μας σε οτιδήποτε χρειαστούν.

recent.comments:
Claire ‘ house est une très jolie maison, bien équipée et située dans un quartier calme, et avec une vue magnifique sur la baie ! 
C’est un peu difficile d’accès, surtout si on n’a pas de véhicule( et avec des bagages…) 
La chambre principale est agréable, bonne clim ( mais matelas vraiment dur ) 
On aurait aimé un changement plus fréquent pour le linge ; 
Mais nous gardons un bon souvenir de notre séjour dans cet endroit ;-)

Second time at this place and we had a great stay again!  Location, house, and host are perfect — thank you!

Το σπίτι ήταν αρκετά όμορφο και η τοποθεσία του ήταν άψογη όπως και η θέα! Βασικό του μειονέκτημα ήταν η έλλειψη κλιματιστικού στο επάνω δωμάτιο κάτι που καθιστούσε τον ύπνο εκεί σχεδόν αδύνατο.. Ο κύριος Μακης από πλευράς του, μας παρείχε έναν ανεμιστήρα, ο οποίος όμως δεν έλυσε το πρόβλημα, δυστυχώς… Θεωρώ πως σε αυτή την τιμή είναι απαράδεκτο να μην μπορείς να κοιμηθείς το βράδυ!

The apartment was lovely with plenty of outdoor areas to enjoy the view from. The kitchen was well equipped as was the bathroom.
The master bedroom was lovely, airy and cool. The second single bedroom was quite small and very hot

The house is very pretty. All the rooms have an amazing  postcard view (except of the two bathrooms), which, however comes with a price of walking a bit uphill (5-10 min to the port and beach). The beds were very comfortable, the master bedroom even has a very nice balcony. The only thing we really missed were mosquito nets or door/window protections, since we lost some serious amount of sleep over the mosquitos and other insects at night. It was a pity to have to close the balcony doors and windows since there was a nice breeze outside. Fortunately the big bedroom had an AC. Otherwise the house was a dream come true! Also Makis drove us to and from the apartment, which was very nice.

We had a wonderful 13 nights at Claire's House; Makis was a great host from initial enquiry through to departure.  The house was in an ideal location, about a 10 minute walk from the harbour area, closer to the beach.  The amenities were as described but the house could do with a little bit of attention to reach 5 stars for everything.  We'd return

Wir sind zum 2. Mal im Claires House und sind erneut vom Aufenthalt begeistert. Makis ist ein sympathischer Gastgeber, der einen herzlich empfängt, Check-in und out unkompliziert gestaltet und unmittelbar auf Nachrichten antwortet. 
Die Unterkunft ist sehr geschmackvoll eingerichtet, sauber und verfügt über alles, was man braucht. Was aber am überwältigt, ist die Aussicht von den beiden Terrassen, der weite Blick über den Hafen und das tiefblaue Meer, das Frühstücken in der Morgensonne und Nachtessen in  der Abendstimmung.
Wir kommen gerne wieder und können die Unterkunft sehr empfehlen. 
Herzlichen Dank!

description.summary: Όμορφη και άνετη μεζονέτα με 2 υπνοδωμάτια και 2 μπάνια, καθιστικό, κουζίνα και 3 βεράντες με καταπληκτική θέα στο Αιγαίο και στα γύρω νησιά. Πολύ κοντά στην πανέμορφη παραλία Λιβαδάκια αλλά και στο Λιβάδι, το λιμάνι και τουριστικό κέντρο του νησιού.
description.space:
Η απλότητα της παραδοσιακής κυκλαδίτικης αρχιτεκτονικής του σπιτιού, παντρεύεται αρμονικά με τους πέτρινους τοίχους, τις πολλές εσοχές και την προσεγμένη διακόσμηση.
Το σπίτι είναι ευρύχωρο 75 μ2 και μπορεί να φιλοξενήσει μέχρι 3 άτομα. 
Στο ισόγειο βρίσκεται το καθιστικό με 4 κτιστούς καναπέδες, ένα μπάνιο και ανεξάρτητος χώρος κουζίνας με ψυγείο, φούρνο και κεραμικές εστίες, πλήρως εξοπλισμένη. Στον όροφο υπάρχει ένα δεύτερο μπάνιο και 2 υπνοδωμάτια με κτιστά κρεβάτια.
Οι 3 βεράντες του σπιτιού έχουν υπέροχη θέα την παραλία Λιβαδάκια ενώ στο βάθος διακρίνεται η Σίφνος.

description.summary: Villa Iris is located in the village of Strapodi and has spectacular views of the famous Venetian Castle that crowns Kapsali Bay. On a clear day, you can see as far as Antikythira with the beautiful Mediterranean blue stretching before you. Kythira is an island of magic, of history and folklore, and we hope our home offers you the perfect stay to explore.

description.access:
Our home has 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms both with toilets and showers, one with a jacuzzi. We have washing machine and drying facilities. A large open-spaced living room that connects with the kitchen and a fireplace in between for the colder months. It is cosy, loved and spacious space, which we are sure you will feel at home in.

Guest access:

You have access to the entire beautiful home, the large balcony with uninterrupted views of Hydra (a must trip on the glass-bottom boat), and our manicured garden – with olive trees, lemon trees and a glorious parisi tree , which you are welcome to explore.

Guest Interaction

You will be greeted upon arrival and we live not too far away if there is anything you want and need. I would be happy to share with you the secrets of the island and offer any recommendations. I am local here and have lived here all my life.

Neighbourhood overview:

Strapodi is the highest village located in the south and considered some of the most desirable property Kythira has to offer. Its views are unmatched. It’s just 3 kms from both Hora (the capital) and Livadi, which are two main villages with shops and wonderful restaurants serving traditional Kytherian food. On Wednesday afternoon there is a street market in Livadi and you can purchase amazing local products. Kytherian Honey is a must! Beaches are close by; Kapsali beach has umbrellas, water sports, cafes, restaurants and bars. Feloti is a secluded beach for those adventurous enough to drive along a cliff edge to get to! There are many others, feel free to ask.

Getting around:

Hiring a car in Kythira is a must. There is an excellent hire car company called Drakakis rent-a-car and I can help you with organizing that at the best price. Kythira also has taxi services, but no buses. There are great walking routes to explore the island.

items.comments: This is a must stay villa in Paros!  Dimitra was a gracious and helpful hostess. Fresh pastries every morning, a kind friendly demeanor, and helpful information about the island that made you feel right at home. Stay here, you won’t be disappointed.
We loved our stay at Dimitra's in Paros. She was such a attentive and generous host as well, greeting us with snacks and beverages! Hope to visit again :)

We stayed at the villa for five days.  Our best day was when we never left it. Lounging and playing in the pool, enjoying the baked goods provided by Dimitra, watching the sunset made for our most memorable and relaxing day of a two week visit to Greece.  Villa number two was spacious for two couples and the daily maid service kept the place spotless throughout our stay. 
You will need a car to get to town, but look for the free parking just outside of town, which is just a quick five minute walk from the center. The villa’s location makes driving to other parts of the island very easy.  
The villa embodies luxury vacationing in Greece.

Our stay at Villa Haritomeni was amazing.  We have stayed at several vacation homes and this was by far our best and most memorable experience. Dimitra is a wonderful host and treats you like family. When we arrived she welcomed us with fresh lemonade, fruit and snacks and ushered us to the patio and pool to relax. She would also bring fresh pastries every morning for us to enjoy. The dogs and cats that live with the family nearby come to visit throughout the day and are gentle and well behaved. My kids loved having them around. No detail is spared inside the home. It is beautifully decorated and just as described.  The views are amazing, especially at sunset! The location is convenient to all points on the island but you will need a car to get around. Christos recommended a rental company that met us at the ferry, and it was a great experience. I can’t recommend this place or Dimitra as a host enough.

We have just had a wonderful 2 week holiday at villa Haritomeni. Dimitra must be the warmest kindest most efficient host you will come across. From delicious pastry’s being brought every morning to being there at a seconds text for any information you could possibly want.
The Villa is much better than than the pictures and the view from the incredible outside terrace is breathtaking and the sunset.. magical. We couldn’t tear ourselves away from the Villa and spent most of our time lazing around the small pool eating outside at one of the two big tables  taking in the breathtaking views ..soaking up the beautiful Greek island air and wonderful light that makes a holiday in Paros such a wonderful health giving get away from it all experience. I can’t wait to go back.

We had the most amazing stay at Villa Haritomeni. I could not recommend this place more, i would give it more than 5 stars if i could. Not only is the villa stunning, with a sprawling view of the bay below and the most beautiful sunset I’ve ever seen, but Dimitra is one of the sweetest people we’ve ever met. 

Prior to our arrival, Christos was wonderful and helped us book car and boat rentals. Upon arrival Dimitra greeted us with open arms, helped us unload our luggage, and stocked the fridge with delicious freshly made juice, wine and some homemade snacks. Every morning she brought down the most delicious freshly made, warm breakfast pastries and ensured everything we needed was taken care of. Staying with Dimitra really felt like staying with family. She even brought us the cutest presents when we left to remember her. We loved Dimitra and her home! 

Parikia and the surrounding area was perfect and had everything we needed. We will definitely be coming back! Thank you Dimitra <3

The interior is a sunny, fresh, island style design with a bedroom featuring a double and a single bed, while the living room offers  double sofa beds. So, the house can accommodate from 4 to 6 guests. 

There is a bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen with stovetop and oven, 2 a/c, a BBQ and a fireplace. 

The highlight is the dining area in a round stone-built area of the living room. The garden is the ideal place to relax or for the kids to play safely. You just enjoy outdoor living, admiring the amazing sunset of Paros…
