name: The Aegean before your very eyes!
title: Kythnos, Greece

gallery.caption: Main House - Stairs to the guest house (MHTE: 1170K92001083601)

hosts.about:
Hi! My name is Anastasia. I was born in Athens, Greece, in 1966 to a family that was involved in the tourist industry. So, although I had studied French Language and Literature at National and Kapodistrian University of Athens, I decided to pursue a career in the same field.
I am a mother of two lovely children; a 17-year-old boy and a 15-year-old girl. I love to spend my free time with family and friends. Thus, I never miss the opportunity to give my beloved ones a treat.
I fell in love with Kythnos the moment I set foot in it some years ago, because, although it is very close to Athens, it preserves its natural beauty and its local custom. I believe it's the perfect place to clear your mind, relax and recharge your batteries.

“ …as the sun rises, the guns of all the great world theories are silenced.
The mind is surpassed by a few waves and some rocks;
absurd perhaps but nevertheless sufficient to lead man 
to his true dimensions.” Odysseus Elytis, Poet, Nobel Prize Winner

recent.comments: Tania is the most welcoming host. She is friendly, helpful, always there to give advice and responsive. She made us feel at home. The villa was spacious, super clean and perfectly equipped. Location was stunning. We wouldn’t change anything.

items.comments: Tania is the most welcoming host. She is friendly, helpful, always there to give advice and responsive. She made us feel at home. The villa was spacious, super clean and perfectly equipped. Location was stunning. We wouldn’t change anything.

Beautiful house with a very professional and kind host, Tania is the best! We had a fantastic week and I would especially like to highlight the wonderful outdoor kitchen and the stunning pool area. All type of groups will be able to enjoy this house and island.

This property is STUNNING. Immaculate home on the edge of the Aegean Sea. Sunrise visible every morning from the master bedroom and guest house beds. The site is windy but Charming with goats scaling the hillside nearby and the constant sound of the sea crashing into the rocks below. Beautiful huge outdoor space. Plenty to explore on the island but also just paradise staying at the home. The host Tania is so warm and welcoming and meeting her feels like reuniting with a long lost friend. She prepared a wonderful welcome meal and had the refrigerator and pantry stocked so we could just relax our first night and day without having to go out for anything. The entire experience was such a treat!

Maison extraordinaire en haut d’une falaise avec son accès privé à la mer.
La vue est imprenable et l’accueil et le confort sont irréprochables.

Tania’s house is the most amazing place. Somehow the photos don’t do it justice even though they do reflect the reality but sometimes you have to see things yourself rather than through a lens.  
The house has incredible views and direct water access to the sea.  
The house is really well equipped - it has everything you could possibly want from all kitchen utensils and equipment, masks and fins, kids toys, adult toys, basketball court, ping pong table, bbq etc. The pool is absolutely lovely too - it’s salt water which is wonderful, it’s deep so no fear when diving in or jumping in. 

And to top it all off, Tania was so welcoming - sharing all her island tips and putting on a lovely welcoming spread for us and putting some beer and wine in the fridge for us! Fani, was lovely too. 

We were a group of friends with the youngest being 6 and the oldest in her 80s and we all had an amazing time Thank you so much! We will definitely come back.

We spent a long weekend at the property with friends from different countries and everyone of us was really impressed upon arrival. The house is located in a secluded place with unrivalled views of the sea.

The common areas and the house inside are beautifully decorated and fully equipped for anything you may need.

The communication with the owner was easy and fast and she did everything in her hand for us to be comfortable.

I cannot recommend highly enough this place. Having travelled extensively the greek islands I can safely say that this is one of the most beautiful places I have stayed in.

What can we say about our stay in this beautiful property other than that it was simply stunning. I would dare say this house and its location right on a small bluff on the Aegean is probably unrivaled on the entire island in terms of privacy, luxury and great hosts. 
We visited with 4 adults and 3 kids and the property easily accommodated all of us. We were greeted by Tania, our host, with a 5-star Brunch and a comprehensive tour of the house,  the amenities and information on all the sights and local haunts to visit during our stay. Simply put, upon arrival, we couldn't have been better welcomed or educated on our surroundings. What we found to be the houses strongest feature is actually the outdoor kitchen and lounge area. Whether its to lie down and take in the breathtaking views of the Aegean and surrounding islands, or to jump in the infinity pool and have a swim, or to have an evening BBQ and outdoor family dinner, this is the place to do it. We also took advantage of the ocean directly beneath the house which is accessibly via a rock staircase and offers an easy and 100% private area to swim, snorkel or just explore around. There are also several very small and secluded public beaches within 10-15 minute drive so if you're looking for a dinner in a local restaurant or a swim somewhere close-by, the location is well suited.

All in all, if we come back to Kythnos, we wouldn't hesitate to stay in this house again...and again.

description.summary: Seaside villa with private, infinity, sea-water pool and a breathtaking view of the Aegean Sea! Within only a few steps from the sea, the villa blends perfectly with the magnificent surroundings, offering one of your most exhilarating experience.
description.space:
Villa Kythnos is a uniquely spectacular, five-bedroom seaside villa at the unspoiled Cycladic island of Kythnos, within only a few steps from the sea.

The property is built on one acre of land and faces East-Northeast, towards Syros and Serifos islands. It is placed at the end of a private country road, at a secluded and tranquil location. It is an ideal holiday destination for those who seek a simpler, more relaxed and carefree vacation.

The main house (200m2) is fully furnished in an elegant style for the utmost comfort of its occupants.

It is composed of two floors; both the first and second floor have separate outdoor access.

The ground floor is on the same level with the swimming pool. This floor has a very comfortable sitting area with two large built-in sofas, a large and fully equipped open-plan kitchen, and a dining room; all very functional and beautifully decorated. On the ground floor, there is also a single-bed bedroom with its bathroom.

On the first floor, there are three bright and spacious bedrooms:
• The master bedroom with a king-size bed, an en-suite bathroom with a shower, and a private balcony with a splendid sea view.
• The second bedroom with one double bed and a sea-view balcony.
• The third bedroom with one double bed.
The second and the third bedroom share the same bathroom with a shower.

Below the swimming pool level, there is a guest house (60m2). It has two bedrooms - one with a double bed and one with two single beds - that share a kitchenette and a bathroom with a shower. The guest house level is independent and accessible through an outdoor staircase from the courtyard.

There is also a ping-pong table and some fitness equipment (ab roller, yoga mats, dumbbells, skipping ropes, flex bands) for you to exercise.

Outside, there is plenty of space for lounging by the private, infinity seawater pool (4.5x11m). The exterior area is designed in such a way that someone can enjoy every minute of the day, depending on the sun position or the wind direction. At the courtyard, you'll find a BBQ next to a shaded dining area, for eating outdoors with your friends or family. The exterior lighting makes Villa Kythnos look magnificent at night while you are enjoying your wine and listening to the music under the stars or the full moon. A lovely, little chapel bathed in a gentle light completes this spectacular scenery.

Every moment at Villa Kythnos will be a memorable experience!
description.notes:
Villa Kythnos is designed with meticulous attention to detail. The house is comfortably furnished and pleasantly decorated in a traditional style. The exterior area is designed in a way that allows you to relish every minute of your stay. Lie down by the pool and feel the warm sun, smell the fresh sea breeze, look at the colorful scenery, listen to the sound of the waves crashing against the rocks, feel the energy of the island. Everything there is food for your senses!

Tip: I would strongly recommend that you get up early one day to watch the sunrise. There is no better way to start your day. The serene and settled majesty to the scenery gratifies the eye and refreshes the spirit. Actually, it is beyond words!
description.neighborhood:
Kythnos, also known as Thermia because of its thermal springs, is located in the Western Cyclades group of islands in the Aegean Sea, between Kea and Serifos. Your journey will last only 90 minutes from Lavrion port and three hours from Piraeus port. Lavrion port is at a distance of 25km from Athens International Airport 'Eleftherios Venizelos'.

Kythnos is a small island with an area of approximately 100 km2 and a coastline of about 100 km. It has 92 coves, inlets and beaches with crystal-clear water, most of which are accessible by road. Worthy of note is Kolona beach with its crescent-shaped isthmus of fine sand; the biggest beach of the island, Apokrousi; and the big, golden beach of Kanala. The island has two big settlements: Chora and Dryopida. Chora is a traditional Cycladic village with winding cobbled streets, stone arches, many small squares and churches. Dryopida, locally known as Chorio, has traditional tiled houses of pretty architecture, old churches, beautiful squares and small windmills. Merichas is the port of the island and it is located on the West coast of the island. There is also the seaside village Kanala on the East side of the island, where the pine forest blends with its golden shores, creating a distinct impression. Its name comes from the church Panagia Kanala with the miraculous image of Holy Mary, which, according to tradition, was found by fishermen in the canal. At the Northeast end of the island, there is a village with a marina, Loutra, known for its thermal springs.

Kythnos has many historical treasures that reveal its long history: remains of walls and many temples dedicated to the ancient gods Aphrodite, Apollo and Demeter; the old walled city of Vryokastro; the ancient harbor in Mandraki; the Castle of Oria to name a few. You may also visit the Museum of local art, the Byzantine Museum and the Agricultural Museum. Kythnos is also the site of one of the largest caves in Greece, Katafyki Cave, in Dryopida, with stalactites and stalagmites.

In July and August, the villagers organize many cultural and religious festival events to revive their customs.

Despite its proximity to Athens, Kythnos has remained unspoiled and combines both an active and a peaceful life. And that’s what makes it unique and a big attraction for visitors.

Villa Kythnos is located within:

- 20min from Merichas – the port of Kythnos
- 15min from Chora – the capital of the island
- 5min from Kanala – the most beautiful seaside village of Kythnos
- 5min from the bus stop, the closest mini market & restaurant
- 10-15min from the Medical Centre
- 20min from the bank
- 5-15min from the closest beaches

(Any times given are by car)
